00041 // If you need some output
00042 // #define PROBELIST_DEBUG 1
00043 
00044 // If the arch cant do unaligned loads and stores we use these fuctions.
00045 // These are in big-endian format.
00046 #ifdef PROBELIST_NEEDS_UNALIGNED
00047 
00048 unsigned int
00049 probelist_load32b(unsigned int* ptr)
00050 {
00051   unsigned char* cptr=(unsigned char*)ptr;
00052   unsigned int val;
00053   val=(cptr[0]<<24)+(cptr[1]<<16)+(cptr[2]<<8)+cptr[3];
00054   return val;
00055 }
00056 unsigned short
00057 probelist_load16b(unsigned short* ptr)
00058 {
00059   unsigned char* cptr=(unsigned char*)ptr;
00060   unsigned short val;
00061   val=(cptr[0]<<8)+cptr[1];
00062   return val;
00063 }
00064 void
00065 probelist_store32b(unsigned int* ptr,unsigned int val)
00066 {
00067   unsigned char* cptr=(unsigned char*)ptr;
00068   cptr[0]=(val>>24);
00069   cptr[1]=(val>>16);
00070   cptr[2]=(val>> 8);
00071   cptr[3]=(val    );
00072 }
00073 void
00074 probelist_store16b(unsigned short* ptr,unsigned short val)
00075 {
00076   char* cptr=(char*)ptr;
00077   cptr[0]=(val>> 8);
00078   cptr[1]=(val    );
00079 }
00080 
00081 #endif

00157 int
00158 ProbeListPacked::pidxToBidx(int pidx) const
00159 {
00160   // in bounds?
00161   int p_cnt=probe_cnt();
00162   if ((pidx<0)||(pidx>=p_cnt)) {
00163     return -1;
00164   }
00165 
00166   int b_cnt=block_cnt();
00167   int rem=pidx;
00168 
00169   for (int b=0;b<b_cnt;b++) {
00170     int b_size=get_blockSize(b);
00171     if (b_size==0) {
00172       continue;
00173     }
00174     // in this block?
00175     if (rem<b_size) {
00176       return b;
00177     }
00178     // not in this block...
00179     rem-=b_size;
00180   }
00181   // the probe is out of bounds.
00182   return -1;
00183 }
00184 
00185 //
00186 bool
00187 ProbeListPacked::isPm(int p_idx) const
00188 {
00189   int num_match=get_numMatch();
00190   int p_max=probe_cnt();
00191 
00192   // check for sanity.
00193   assert((num_match==1)||(num_match==2));
00194   assert((0<=p_idx)&&(p_idx<p_max));
00195   // APT_ERR_ASSERT and especially ToStr() are big performance hits right here.
00196 
00197 //   APT_ERR_ASSERT(((num_match==1)||(num_match==2)),"num_match must be 1 or 2. " + ToStr(num_match));
00198 //   APT_ERR_ASSERT(((0<=p_idx)&&(p_idx<p_max)),"p_idx out of bounds.");
00199 
00200   // by definition, if there is one match, then it has to be a PM.
00201   if (num_match==1) {
00202     return true;
00203   }
00204 
00205   // we have PM and MM probes...
00206   if (num_match==2) {
00207     // Like pidxToBidx, but we unroll it here to keep some state.
00208     // step though the blocks, to find the block and then test to see
00209     // if it is in the first half of the block.
00210     int p_rem=p_idx; // probe remainder
00211     int b_cnt=block_cnt();
00212     for (int b=0;b<b_cnt;b++) {
00213       int b_size=get_blockSize(b);
00214       // no probes in a zero sized block
00215       if (b_size==0) {
00216         continue;
00217       }
00218       // is the probe index in this block?
00219       if (p_rem<b_size) {
00220         // in the first half is a PM;
00221         if (p_rem<(b_size/2)) {
00222           return true;
00223         }
00224         else {
00225           return false;
00226         }
00227       }
00228       // not in this block, deduct the size...
00229       p_rem-=b_size;
00230     }
00231   }
00232 
00233   APT_ERR_ABORT("Shouldnt get here.");
00234   return false;
00235 }

00343 /////
00344 
00345 /// @todo this should be somehow unified with the ProbeListStl version.
00346 int ProbeListPacked::findBlockMatch(int qAllele,int qContext,int qChannel) const
00347 {
00348   for (int b=0;b<block_cnt();b++) {
00349     if ((qAllele==get_blockAllele(b)) &&
00350         (qContext==get_blockContext(b)) &&
00351         (qChannel==get_blockChannel(b))) {
00352       return b;
00353     }
00354   }
00355   return -1;
00356 }
00357 
00358 bool ProbeListPacked::hasDuplicateBlocks() const
00359 {
00360   for (int b=0;b<block_cnt();b++) {
00361     int idx=findBlockMatch(get_blockAllele(b),get_blockContext(b),get_blockChannel(b));
00362     if (idx!=b) {
00363       return true;
00364     }
00365   }
00366   return false;
00367 }

00389 // Probe getters & setters
00390 ProbeList_E_Probe*
00391 ProbeListPacked::get_addr_E_probe(unsigned int idx) const
00392 {
00393   assert(m_headptr!=NULL);
00394   assert(idx<probe_cnt());
00395   // APT_ERR_ASSERT, get_name_string(), and especially ToStr() are big
00396   // performance hits right here.
00397 
00398 //   APT_ERR_ASSERT(m_headptr!=NULL,
00399 //                  "Head pointer is NULL.");
00400 //   APT_ERR_ASSERT(idx<probe_cnt(),
00401 //                  "Probeset: '" + get_name_string() + "' - wrong number of probes."
00402 //                  "(Max: " + ToStr(probe_cnt() - 1) + " Got: " + ToStr(idx)+")");
00403 
00404   char* ptr=(char*)m_headptr+sizeof(ProbeList_Head)+
00405     (block_cnt()*sizeof(ProbeList_E_Block))+
00406     (idx*sizeof(ProbeList_E_Probe));
00407   return (ProbeList_E_Probe*)ptr;
00408 }

00410 int
00411 ProbeListPacked::get_probeId(int i) const
00412 {
00413   return PROBELIST_LOAD32B(&get_addr_E_probe(i)->m_probeId);
00414 }
00415 void
00416 ProbeListPacked::set_probeId(int i,int val)
00417 {
00418   PROBELIST_STORE32B(&get_addr_E_probe(i)->m_probeId,val);
00419 }
00420 void
00421 ProbeListPacked::get_probeIds(std::vector<int>& probeids) const
00422 {
00423   int p_cnt=probe_cnt();
00424   probeids.resize(p_cnt);
00425 
00426   if (p_cnt==0) {
00427     return;
00428   }
00429 
00430   // get the address of the first probe.
00431   ProbeList_E_Probe* p_ptr=get_addr_E_probe(0);
00432   for (int i=0;i<p_cnt;i++) {
00433     probeids[i]=p_ptr->m_probeId;
00434     p_ptr++;
00435   }
00436 }
00437 
00438 int
00439 ProbeListPacked::get_probeIdxForBlock(int blockIdx) const
00440 {
00441   APT_ERR_ASSERT(blockIdx<block_cnt(),"blockIdx out of range.");
00442 
00443   int probeIdx=0;
00444   for (int bi=0;bi<blockIdx;bi++) {
00445     probeIdx+=get_blockSize(bi);
00446   }
00447   return probeIdx;
00448 }
00449 
00450 void
00451 ProbeListPacked::get_probeIdsForBlock(int blockIdx,std::vector<int>& probeids) const
00452 {
00453   int p_cnt=get_blockSize(blockIdx);
00454   probeids.resize(p_cnt);
00455 
00456   if (p_cnt==0) {
00457     return;
00458   }
00459 
00460   // get the address of the first probe.
00461   int p_idx=get_probeIdxForBlock(blockIdx);
00462   ProbeList_E_Probe* p_ptr=get_addr_E_probe(p_idx);
00463   for (int i=0;i<p_cnt;i++) {
00464     probeids[i]=p_ptr->m_probeId;
00465     p_ptr++;
00466   }
00467 }

00471 {
00472   if ((i>=0)&&(i<m_headptr->m_probe_cnt)) {

00475   return -1;

00510 const char*
00511 ProbeListPacked::get_name_cstr() const
00512 {
00513   assert(m_headptr!=NULL);
00514   int name_len=PROBELIST_LOAD16B(&m_headptr->m_name_len);
00515   if (name_len==0) {
00516     return NULL;
00517   }
00518   return get_addr_E_name();
00519 }
00520 
00521 std::string
00522 ProbeListPacked::get_name_string() const
00523 {
00524   std::string name;
00525   name=get_addr_E_name();
00526   return name;
00527 }
00528 
00529 void
00530 ProbeListPacked::set_name(const std::string &name)
00531 {
00532   assert(m_headptr!=NULL);
00533   int   name_len=PROBELIST_LOAD16B(&m_headptr->m_name_len);
00534 
00535   if (name_len>0) { // there is space
00536     char* name_ptr=get_addr_E_name();
00537     if (name_len>1) { // more than just a null?
00538       // trunc the name to fit.
00539       strncpy(name_ptr,name.c_str(),name_len-1);
00540     }
00541     // strncpy might not put the final '0'
00542     name_ptr[name_len-1]=0;
00543   }
00544 }
00545 
00546 int
00547 ProbeListPacked::findProbeApid(int qPid,int qAllele,int qContext,int qChannel) const
00548 {
00549   int pidx_start;
00550   int pidx_end;
00551   // "pidx" is the internal offset in this ProbeListPacked
00552   pidx_start=0;
00553   for (int b=0;b<m_headptr->m_block_cnt;b++) {
00554     // does this block match?
00555     if ((get_blockAllele(b)==qAllele) &&
00556         (get_blockContext(b)==qContext) &&
00557         (get_blockChannel(b)==qChannel))
00558     {
00559       // hit on block, se
00560       pidx_end=pidx_start+get_blockSize(b);
00561       for (int pidx=pidx_start;pidx<pidx_end;pidx++) {
00562         // should be renamed to "get_probeid(pidx)"
00563         if (get_probeId(pidx)==qPid) {
00564           return getApidStart()+pidx;
00565         }
00566       }
00567       // not found in this block
00568       pidx_start+=get_blockSize(b);
00569     }
00570     else {
00571       pidx_start+=get_blockSize(b);
00572     }
00573   }
00574   // not found
00575   return -1;
00576 }
00577 
00578 
00579 #define PLP_DUMP "#PLP: "
00580 void
00581 ProbeListPacked::dump() const
00582 {
00583   if (isNull()) {
00584     printf(PLP_DUMP " %p: isNull",this);
00585     return;
00586   }
00587 
00588   int b_cnt=block_cnt();
00589   int p_cnt=probe_cnt();
00590   int num_match=get_numMatch();
00591 
00592   printf(PLP_DUMP "%p: '%s'  b_cnt=%d  p_cnt=%d  num_match=%d\n",
00593          this,get_name_cstr(),b_cnt,p_cnt,num_match);
00594 
00595   if (b_cnt>0) {
00596     printf(PLP_DUMP "Size____ Anno____ Allele_ Context_ Channel_ RepType_\n");
00597     for (int b=0;b<b_cnt;b++) {
00598       printf(PLP_DUMP "%8d %8d %8d %8d %8d %8d\n",
00599              get_blockSize(b),
00600              get_blockAnn(b),
00601              get_blockAllele(b),
00602              get_blockContext(b),
00603              get_blockChannel(b),
00604              get_blockRepType(b));
00605     }
00606   }
00607   //
00608   if (p_cnt>0) {
00609     printf(PLP_DUMP "ID______ GC APID____ ____\n");
00610     for (int p=0;p<p_cnt;p++) {
00611       printf(PLP_DUMP "%8d %2d %8d %4s\n",
00612              get_probeId(p),get_probeGc(p),get_probeApid(p),
00613              (isPm(p)?"PM":"  mm"));
00614     }
00615   }
00616 }

00623 // *poof!* A new heap is born!
00624 ProbeListFactory::ProbeListFactory() : m_numCols(0), m_numRows(0), m_numChannels(1)
00625 {
00626   m_probeid2apid_vecptr=NULL;
00627   //
00628   delete_regions(); // also clears counters
00629   set_default_region_size(1024*1024); // default size
00630 }
00631 //
00632 ProbeListFactory::~ProbeListFactory()
00633 {
00634   delete_regions();
00635 }
00636 
00637 //
00638 void
00639 ProbeListFactory::set_default_region_size(int size)
00640 {
00641   m_default_region_size=size;
00642 }
00643 
00644 //
00645 void
00646 ProbeListFactory::new_region()
00647 {
00648   new_region(m_default_region_size);
00649 }
00650 
00651 void
00652 ProbeListFactory::new_region(int region_size)
00653 {
00654 #ifdef PROBELIST_DEBUG
00655   printf("alloc_region(%d,%d)\n",m_ridx,region_size);
00656 #endif
00657   ProbeListFactory_Region new_region;
00658   m_region.push_back(new_region);
00659   //
00660   m_region[m_ridx].m_start_ptr=(char*)malloc(region_size);
00661   assert(m_region[m_ridx].m_start_ptr!=NULL);
00662   memset(m_region[m_ridx].m_start_ptr,0,region_size);
00663   m_region[m_ridx].m_fill_ptr=m_region[m_ridx].m_start_ptr;
00664   m_region[m_ridx].m_end_ptr=m_region[m_ridx].m_start_ptr+region_size;
00665 }
00666 
00667 // Get rid of all our memory.
00668 void
00669 ProbeListFactory::delete_regions()
00670 {
00671   // clear the memory.
00672   clear();
00673 
00674   // free the memory...
00675   for (unsigned int i=0;i<m_region.size();i++) {
00676     free(m_region[i].m_start_ptr);
00677   }
00678   // ...and reset the vec
00679   m_region.clear();
00680 }
00681 
00682 // zero out our info.
00683 void
00684 ProbeListFactory::clear()
00685 {
00686 #ifdef PROBELIST_DEBUG
00687   printf("heap.clear()\n");
00688 #endif
00689   //
00690   m_ridx=0;
00691   m_allocs=0;
00692   m_probecnt_total=0;
00693   //
00694   m_probelist_vec.clear();
00695   //
00696   m_name2idx_vec.clear();
00697   m_name2idx_issorted=false;
00698   m_name2idx_sortcnt=0;
00699   //
00700   for (size_t i=0;i<m_region.size();i++) {
00701     m_region[i].m_fill_ptr=m_region[i].m_start_ptr;
00702     // zero out the region for future use.
00703     unsigned int len=m_region[i].m_end_ptr-m_region[i].m_start_ptr;
00704     memset(m_region[i].m_start_ptr,0,len);
00705   }
00706 
00707   delete m_probeid2apid_vecptr;
00708   m_probeid2apid_vecptr=NULL;
00709 }
00710 
00711 //
00712 char*
00713 ProbeListFactory::alloc_ProbeList_bytes(int size)
00714 {
00715   m_allocs++;
00716   // Work along the regions until we find space
00717   while (1) {
00718     //printf("alloc_bytes(%d)\n",size);
00719     // have an active region?
00720     if (m_region.size()<=m_ridx) {
00721       // make it at least big enough for this allocation
00722       if (m_default_region_size<size) {
00723         new_region(size);
00724       }
00725       else {
00726         new_region(m_default_region_size);
00727       }
00728     }
00729 
00730     char* new_fill_ptr;
00731     char* list_ptr;
00732 
00733     // able to alloc from the current region?
00734     list_ptr=m_region[m_ridx].m_fill_ptr;
00735     new_fill_ptr=list_ptr+size;
00736     if (new_fill_ptr<=m_region[m_ridx].m_end_ptr) {
00737       m_region[m_ridx].m_fill_ptr=new_fill_ptr;
00738       // for debugging, wack the region just allocated with
00739       // an easy to spot value
00740       // memset(list_ptr,-1,size);
00741       return list_ptr;
00742     }
00743 
00744     // Nope! move on to the next region.
00745     m_ridx++;
00746   }
00747   // not reached && keep gcc happy
00748   assert(0);
00749   return NULL;
00750 }
00751 
00752 //
00753 void ProbeListFactory::reserve(int size)
00754 {
00755   m_probelist_vec.reserve(size);
00756   m_name2idx_vec.reserve(size);
00757 }
00758 
00759 void
00760 ProbeListFactory::name2idx_dirty()
00761 {
00762   m_name2idx_issorted=false;
00763 }
00764 
00765 //////////
00766 
00767 /// Finish adding the packed probelist to the factory
00768 void
00769 ProbeListFactory::add_probelist_finish(ProbeListPacked& pl)
00770 {
00771   // cant add a null probelist
00772   APT_ERR_ASSERT(!pl.isNull(),"pl.isNull()");
00773   // set the start of the list and update the total...
00774   pl.setApidStart(m_probecnt_total);
00775   m_probecnt_total+=pl.probe_cnt();
00776   // also add the index to the name2idx vec...
00777   m_name2idx_vec.push_back(m_probelist_vec.size());
00778   // add it
00779   m_probelist_vec.push_back(pl);
00780   // ...which is no longer sorted.
00781   name2idx_dirty();
00782 }
00783 
00784 //
00785 ProbeListPacked
00786 ProbeListFactory::add_ProbeList(int block_cnt,int probe_cnt,int name_len)
00787 {
00788   ProbeListPacked pl;
00789   //
00790   /// @todo change all asserts to APT_ERR_ASSERT()
00791   assert((unsigned int)block_cnt<PROBELIST_BLOCK_CNT_MAX);
00792   assert((unsigned int)probe_cnt<PROBELIST_PROBE_CNT_MAX);
00793   assert((unsigned int)name_len<PROBELIST_NAME_LEN_MAX);
00794   //
00795   int required_size=pl.byte_size(block_cnt,probe_cnt,name_len);
00796   pl.m_headptr=(ProbeList_Head*)alloc_ProbeList_bytes(required_size);
00797   assert(pl.m_headptr!=NULL);
00798   //
00799   PROBELIST_STORE32B(&pl.m_headptr->m_block_cnt,block_cnt);
00800   PROBELIST_STORE32B(&pl.m_headptr->m_probe_cnt,probe_cnt);
00801   PROBELIST_STORE16B(&pl.m_headptr->m_name_len,name_len);
00802   //
00803   add_probelist_finish(pl);
00804   return pl;
00805 };
00806 
00807 //
00808 ProbeListPacked
00809 ProbeListFactory::add_ProbeList(int block_cnt,int probe_cnt, const std::string &name)
00810 {
00811   // +1 for the null
00812   ProbeListPacked pl=add_ProbeList(block_cnt,probe_cnt,name.size()+1);
00813   pl.set_name(name);
00814   //
00815   return pl;
00816 }
00817 
00818 // Be sure to keep ProbeListStl::opreator= updated.
00819 ProbeListPacked
00820 ProbeListFactory::add_ProbeList(const ProbeListStl& pls)
00821 {
00822   // Refuse to add probelists which have duplicates.
00823   APT_ERR_ASSERT(pls.hasDuplicateBlocks()==false,"internal error");
00824 
00825   //
00826   ProbeListPacked plp;
00827 
00828   // this adds it to m_probelist_vec so we dont.
00829   plp=add_ProbeList(pls.block_cnt(),pls.probe_cnt(),pls.get_name_string());
00830   //
00831   plp.set_type(pls.get_type());
00832   plp.set_numMatch(pls.get_numMatch());
00833   //
00834   for (int i=0;i<pls.block_cnt();i++) {
00835     plp.set_blockSize(i,pls.get_blockSize(i));
00836     plp.set_blockAllele(i,pls.get_blockAllele(i));
00837     plp.set_blockContext(i,pls.get_blockContext(i));
00838     plp.set_blockChannel(i,pls.get_blockChannel(i));
00839     plp.set_blockRepType(i,pls.get_blockRepType(i));
00840   }
00841   for (int i=0;i<pls.probe_cnt();i++) {
00842     plp.set_probeId(i,pls.get_probeId(i));
00843     plp.set_probeGc(i,pls.get_probeGc(i));
00844     // we dont store the universal probe as ProbeListFactory computes that.
00845   }
00846   // compare the two items by eye.
00847   //pls.dump();
00848   //plp.dump();
00849   return plp;
00850 }
00851 
00852 double ProbeListFactory::safe_div(double a,double b)
00853 {
00854   if (b==0.0) {
00855     return 0.0;
00856   }
00857   return (a/b);
00858 }
00859 
00860 void
00861 ProbeListFactory::dump_regions() const
00862 {
00863   unsigned int space=0;
00864   unsigned int used=0;
00865   unsigned int total_space=0;
00866   unsigned int total_used=0;
00867   double percent;
00868   double avg_size;
00869 
00870   printf("== ProbeListFactory Usage: (this=%p) allocs=%u\n",this,m_allocs);
00871   printf("== Reg | Ptr_____________ | Size____ | Used____ | %%____ |\n");
00872   for (unsigned int r=0;r<m_region.size();r++) {
00873     space=m_region[r].m_end_ptr -m_region[r].m_start_ptr;
00874     used =m_region[r].m_fill_ptr-m_region[r].m_start_ptr;
00875     total_space+=space;
00876     total_used+=used;
00877     percent=safe_div(used,space)*100.0;
00878     printf("== %3d | %16p | %8u | %8u | %5.2f |\n",
00879            r,m_region[r].m_start_ptr,space,used,percent);
00880   }
00881   percent=safe_div(total_used,total_space)*100.0;
00882   printf("== Total:                 | %8u | %8u | %5.2f |\n",total_space,total_used,percent);
00883   avg_size=safe_div(total_used,m_allocs);
00884   printf("== avg size=%6.1f\n",avg_size);
00885 
00886 }
00887 
00888 // @todo change back
00889 // ProbeListPacked
00890 void
00891 ProbeListFactory::pListFromPSet(const ProbeSet &ps) {
00892   unsigned char nGroups = max((int)ps.numGroups,1);
00893   bool hasMM = hasNonPm(ps);
00894   string name;
00895   int pmCount = countPmProbes(&ps);
00896   int probeCount = pmCount;
00897 
00898   if(hasMM) {
00899     probeCount += pmCount;
00900   }
00901 
00902   // are we using a name or an id?
00903   if(ps.name != NULL && !Util::sameString(ps.name, ""))
00904     name = ps.name;
00905   else {
00906     Err::errAbort("ProbeListFactory::pListFromPSet() - No name for probeset.");
00907   }
00908   //
00909   ProbeListPacked pList = add_ProbeList(nGroups, probeCount, name );
00910   // let people know we have mismatches.
00911   if(hasMM)
00912     pList.set_numMatch(2);
00913   else
00914     pList.set_numMatch(1);
00915   //  pList.set_block(0,0);
00916   pList.set_type(ps.psType);
00917   // fill the probes with null_probe indicator to trip ourselves up if we try to use them
00918   for(int i = 0; i < probeCount; i++)
00919     pList.set_probeId(i, ProbeList::null_probe);
00920   int pCount = 0;
00921   vector<int> atomProbes(ps.atoms.size(), 0);
00922   // fill in the probes.
00923   for(uint32_t atomIx = 0; atomIx < ps.atoms.size(); atomIx++) {
00924     Atom *a = ps.atoms[atomIx];
00925     for(uint32_t probeIx = 0; probeIx < a->probes.size(); ++probeIx) {
00926       Probe *current = a->probes[probeIx];
00927       Probe *next = NULL;
00928       atomProbes[atomIx]++;
00929       if(probeIx +1 < a->probes.size())
00930         next = a->probes[probeIx + 1];
00931       // if it is an pm-mm set then put pm in front and mm in matching position.
00932       if(Probe::isPm(*current) && next != NULL && Probe::isMm(*next)) {
00933         pList.set_probeId(pCount, current->id);
00934         pList.set_probeGc(pCount, current->gcCount);
00935         pList.set_probeId(pCount + pmCount, next->id);
00936         pList.set_probeGc(pCount + pmCount, next->gcCount);
00937         probeIx++; // advance probeIx count as we did two.
00938       }
00939       // if it is a lone mm then put a "null_probe" in for the pm probe.
00940       if(!Probe::isPm(*current)) {
00941         pList.set_probeId(pCount, ProbeList::null_probe);
00942         pList.set_probeGc(pCount, -1);
00943         pList.set_probeId(pCount + pmCount, current->id);
00944         pList.set_probeGc(pCount + pmCount, current->gcCount);
00945       }
00946       // lone pm probe
00947       else {
00948         pList.set_probeId(pCount, current->id);
00949         pList.set_probeGc(pCount, current->gcCount);
00950       }
00951       pCount++;
00952     }
00953   }
00954 
00955   // the first atom is taken as to have allele and context for its block.
00956   int atomIdx=0;
00957   for(int groupIx=0; groupIx < ps.numGroups; groupIx++) {
00958     Atom* a=ps.atoms[atomIdx];
00959     atomIdx+=ps.atomsPerGroup[groupIx];
00960     //
00961     pList.set_blockAllele(groupIx,a->allele_code);
00962     pList.set_blockContext(groupIx,a->context_code);
00963     pList.set_blockChannel(groupIx,a->channel_code);
00964     pList.set_blockRepType(groupIx,a->replication_type);
00965   }
00966 
00967   /* Setup the block offsets into the probe array. */
00968   int last = 0;
00969   int current = 0;
00970   for(int groupIx = 0; groupIx < ps.numGroups; groupIx++) {
00971     current += ps.atomsPerGroup[groupIx];
00972     int probeAtomCount=0;
00973     for(; last < current; last++) {
00974       probeAtomCount += atomProbes[last];
00975     }
00976     pList.set_blockSize(groupIx, probeAtomCount);
00977     pList.set_blockAnn(groupIx, ProbeList::NoAnnotation);
00978   }
00979   if(ps.numGroups == 4 &&
00980      (ps.psType == ProbeSet::GenoType)) {
00981     pList.set_blockAnn(0, ProbeList::A_AlleleForward);
00982     pList.set_blockAnn(1, ProbeList::B_AlleleForward);
00983     pList.set_blockAnn(2, ProbeList::A_AlleleReverse);
00984     pList.set_blockAnn(3, ProbeList::B_AlleleReverse);
00985   }
00986   else if(ps.numGroups == 2 &&
00987           (ps.psType == ProbeSet::GenoType)) {
00988     pList.set_blockAnn(0, ProbeList::A_Allele);
00989     pList.set_blockAnn(1, ProbeList::B_Allele);
00990   }
00991 
00992   //return pList;
00993 }
00994 
00995 bool ProbeListFactory::maybeInsertProbe(Atom *a, int position, int id, unsigned char gcCount, unsigned char type,int apid) {
00996   if (id != ProbeList::null_probe) {
00997     Probe *p = new Probe();
00998     p->id = id;
00999     p->type = type;
01000     p->gcCount = gcCount;
01001     p->m_apid=apid;
01002     //
01003     a->probes[position] = p;
01004     return true;
01005   }
01006   return false;
01007 }
01008 
01009 /// @todo this should be "ProbeSet::operator=()"
01010 ProbeSet *ProbeListFactory::asProbeSet(const ProbeListPacked& pl) {
01011   ProbeSet *ps = new ProbeSet();
01012   ps->name = Util::cloneString(pl.get_name_cstr());
01013   ps->psType = (ProbeSet::ProbeSetType)pl.get_type();
01014   ps->numGroups = pl.block_cnt();
01015   ps->atomsPerGroup.resize(ps->numGroups, 0);
01016   bool hasMM = pl.get_numMatch() == 2;
01017   int pmCount = pl.probe_cnt() / pl.get_numMatch();
01018 
01019   ps->atoms.resize(pl.block_cnt()); // make an atom for each block...
01020   int currentProbeStart = 0;
01021   for(int atomIx = 0; atomIx < ps->atoms.size(); atomIx++) {
01022     Atom *a = new Atom();
01023     ps->atoms[atomIx] = a;
01024 
01025     a->id = atomIx;
01026     a->allele_code=pl.get_blockAllele(atomIx);
01027     a->context_code=pl.get_blockContext(atomIx);
01028     a->channel_code=pl.get_blockChannel(atomIx);
01029     a->replication_type=(Atom::ReplicationType)pl.get_blockRepType(atomIx);
01030 
01031     int notNullCount = 0;
01032     int atomProbeEnd = pl.get_blockSize(atomIx) + currentProbeStart;
01033 
01034     for(int i = currentProbeStart; i < atomProbeEnd; i++) {
01035       if(pl.get_probeId(i) != ProbeList::null_probe) {
01036         notNullCount++;
01037       }
01038       if(hasMM && pl.get_probeId(i+pmCount) != ProbeList::null_probe) {
01039         notNullCount++;
01040       }
01041     }
01042     a->probes.resize(notNullCount);
01043 
01044     ps->atomsPerGroup[atomIx] = 1; // can do this as there is just one atom per block.
01045     int probesInserted = 0;
01046     for(int i = currentProbeStart; i < atomProbeEnd; i++) {
01047       int probeIndex = i;
01048       int pId = pl.get_probeId(probeIndex);
01049       // regular pm-mm pair
01050       ///@todo I do not think we keep track of st vs at probes -- so we should really
01051       ///      have a Probe::PM and Probe::MM and set that here
01052       if (pId != ProbeList::null_probe && hasMM) {
01053         if (maybeInsertProbe(a, probesInserted, pId, pl.get_probeGc(probeIndex), Probe::PMST,pl.get_probeApid(probeIndex)))
01054           probesInserted++;
01055         int mmId = pl.get_probeId(i+pmCount);
01056         if (maybeInsertProbe(a, probesInserted, mmId, pl.get_probeGc(probeIndex+pmCount), Probe::MMST,pl.get_probeApid(probeIndex+pmCount)))
01057           probesInserted++;
01058       }
01059       else if (pId == ProbeList::null_probe && hasMM) {
01060         int mmId = pl.get_probeId(i+pmCount);
01061         if (maybeInsertProbe(a, probesInserted, mmId, pl.get_probeGc(probeIndex+pmCount), Probe::MMST,pl.get_probeApid(probeIndex+pmCount)))
01062           probesInserted++;
01063       }
01064       else if (pId != ProbeList::null_probe) {
01065         if (maybeInsertProbe(a, probesInserted, pId, pl.get_probeGc(probeIndex), Probe::PMST,pl.get_probeApid(probeIndex)))
01066           probesInserted++;
01067       }
01068       else {
01069         Err::errAbort("Null probe with no mismatch in probeset: " + ToStr(ps->name));
01070       }
01071       if(probesInserted > a->probes.size()) {
01072         Err::errAbort("ProbeListFactory::asProbeSet() - " + ToStr(ps->name) + "More probes than space for.");
01073       }
01074     }
01075     currentProbeStart += atomProbeEnd - currentProbeStart;
01076   }
01077   return ps;
01078 }
01079 
01080 bool ProbeListFactory::hasNonPm(const ProbeSet &ps) {
01081   for(uint32_t atomIx = 0; atomIx < ps.atoms.size(); ++atomIx) {
01082     Atom *a = ps.atoms[atomIx];
01083     for(uint32_t probeIx = 0; probeIx < a->probes.size(); ++probeIx) {
01084       if(!Probe::isPm(*(a->probes[probeIx]))) {
01085         return true;
01086       }
01087     }
01088   }
01089   return false;
01090 }
01091 
01092 unsigned int ProbeListFactory::countPmProbes(const ProbeSet *ps) {
01093   unsigned int atomPmCount = 0;
01094   for(int atomIx = 0; atomIx < ps->atoms.size(); atomIx++) {
01095     Atom &atom = *(ps->atoms[atomIx]);
01096     for(int probeIx = 0; probeIx < atom.probes.size(); probeIx++) {
01097       Probe *p = atom.probes[probeIx];
01098       Probe *next = NULL;
01099       if(probeIx + 1 < atom.probes.size()) {
01100         next = atom.probes[probeIx + 1];
01101       }
01102       if(p->type != Probe::MMST && p->type != Probe::MMAT) {
01103         atomPmCount++;
01104         if(next != NULL && Probe::isMm(*next)) {
01105           probeIx++;
01106         }
01107       }
01108       else if(!Probe::isPm(*p)) {
01109         atomPmCount++;
01110       }
01111     }
01112   }
01113   return atomPmCount;
01114 }

01119 ProbeListFactory::dump() const

01121   dump_regions();
01122   dump_probelists();

01124 
01125 void
01126 ProbeListFactory::dump_probelist(int i) const
01127 {
01128   if ((0<=i)||(i<m_probelist_vec.size())) {
01129     m_probelist_vec[i].dump();
01130   }
01131   else {
01132     printf("# %3d : out of bounds. (0-%d)\n",i,int(m_probelist_vec.size()));
01133   }
01134 }
01135 
01136 void
01137 ProbeListFactory::dump_probelists() const
01138 {
01139   for (int i=0;i<m_probelist_vec.size();i++) {
01140     printf(" %3d :",i);
01141     m_probelist_vec[i].dump();
01142   }
01143 }

01145 //////////
01146 
01147 void read_spf_v2(ProbeListFactory& plf,affx::SpfFile& spfFile)
01148 {
01149   ProbeListStl pl;
01150   //
01151   std::string i_name;
01152   int i_type;
01153   int i_num_blocks;
01154   int i_num_probes;
01155   // @todo this should be used.
01156   // int i_block_sizes;
01157   int i_num_match;
01158   std::vector<int> i_vector;
01159   //int pi;
01160 
01161   //
01162   while (spfFile.nextLevel(0)==affx::TSV_OK) {
01163     //
01164     pl.clear();
01165     //
01166     spfFile.get(0,spfFile.m_name_cidx,i_name);
01167     pl.set_name(i_name);
01168     //
01169     //printf("%s\n",pl.get_name_cstr());
01170     //
01171     i_type=-1;
01172     spfFile.get(0,spfFile.m_type_cidx,i_type);
01173     pl.set_type(i_type);
01174     //
01175     i_num_blocks=-1;
01176     i_num_probes=-1;
01177     spfFile.get(0,spfFile.m_v2_num_blocks_cidx,i_num_blocks);
01178     spfFile.get(0,spfFile.m_v2_num_probes_cidx,i_num_probes);
01179     //
01180     pl.resize(0,0);
01181     pl.resize(i_num_blocks,i_num_probes);
01182     // @todo: for now we assume and check all the blocks are the same size.
01183     spfFile.get(0,spfFile.m_v2_block_sizes_cidx,&i_vector);
01184     //for (int i=0;i<i_vector.size();i++) {
01185     //  APT_ERR_ASSERT(i_vector[0]==i_vector[i],"block size mismatch. dataline="+ToStr(spfFile.lineNumber()));
01186     //}
01187     for (int i=0;i<i_num_blocks;i++) {
01188       pl.set_blockSize(i,i_vector[i]);
01189     }
01190     //
01191     i_num_match=-1;
01192     if (spfFile.m_num_match_cidx>=0) {
01193       spfFile.get(0,spfFile.m_num_match_cidx,i_num_match);
01194     }
01195     else {
01196       i_num_match=1;
01197     }
01198     pl.set_numMatch(i_num_match);
01199     //
01200     spfFile.get(0,spfFile.m_v2_block_annotations_cidx,&i_vector);
01201     for (int i=0;i<i_num_blocks;i++) {
01202       pl.set_blockAnn(i,i_vector[i]);
01203     }
01204     // required annotations
01205     spfFile.get(0,spfFile.m_v2_block_annotations_cidx,&i_vector);
01206     for (int i=0;i<i_num_blocks;i++) {
01207       pl.set_blockAnn(i,i_vector[i]);
01208     }
01209     // required probes
01210     spfFile.get(0,spfFile.m_v2_probes_cidx,&i_vector);
01211     APT_ERR_ASSERT((i_vector.size()==i_num_probes),"probe count mismatch");
01212     for (int i=0;i<i_vector.size();i++) {
01213       pl.set_probeId(i,TO_ZEROBASED(i_vector[i]));
01214       pl.set_probeApid(i,-1);
01215     }
01216     // optional columns...
01217     //
01218     if (spfFile.m_v2_block_alleles_cidx>=0) {
01219       spfFile.get(0,spfFile.m_v2_block_alleles_cidx,&i_vector);
01220       for (int i=0;i<i_vector.size();i++) {
01221         pl.set_blockAllele(i,i_vector[i]);
01222       }
01223     }
01224     if (spfFile.m_v2_block_contexts_cidx>=0) {
01225       spfFile.get(0,spfFile.m_v2_block_contexts_cidx,&i_vector);
01226       for (int i=0;i<i_vector.size();i++) {
01227         pl.set_blockContext(i,i_vector[i]);
01228       }
01229     }
01230     if (spfFile.m_v2_block_channels_cidx>=0) {
01231       spfFile.get(0,spfFile.m_v2_block_channels_cidx,&i_vector);
01232       for (int i=0;i<i_vector.size();i++) {
01233         pl.set_blockChannel(i,i_vector[i]);
01234       }
01235     }
01236     if (spfFile.m_v2_block_rep_types_cidx>=0) {
01237       spfFile.get(0,spfFile.m_v2_block_rep_types_cidx,&i_vector);
01238       for (int i=0;i<i_vector.size();i++) {
01239         pl.set_blockRepType(i,i_vector[i]);
01240       }
01241     }
01242     //
01243     plf.add_ProbeList(pl);
01244   } // while
01245 }
01246 
01247 void read_spf_v3(ProbeListFactory& plf,affx::SpfFile& spfFile)
01248 {
01249   ProbeListStl pl;
01250   //
01251   std::string i_name;
01252   int i_type;
01253   int i_num_match;
01254   int i_annotation_code;
01255   int i_allele_code;
01256   int i_context_code;
01257   int i_channel_code;
01258   int i_rep_type = 0;
01259   int i_probe_id;
01260 
01261   //
01262   while (spfFile.nextLevel(0)==affx::TSV_OK) {
01263     pl.clear();
01264     //
01265     spfFile.get(0,spfFile.m_name_cidx,i_name);
01266     pl.set_name(i_name);
01267     //
01268     i_type=-1;
01269     spfFile.get(0,spfFile.m_type_cidx,i_type);
01270     pl.set_type(i_type);
01271     //
01272     i_num_match=-1;
01273     if (spfFile.m_num_match_cidx>=0) {
01274       spfFile.get(0,spfFile.m_num_match_cidx,i_num_match);
01275     }
01276     else {
01277       i_num_match=1;
01278     }
01279     pl.set_numMatch(i_num_match);
01280     //
01281     while (spfFile.nextLevel(1)==affx::TSV_OK) {
01282       spfFile.get(1, spfFile.m_v3_allele_code_cidx, i_allele_code);
01283       //
01284       while (spfFile.nextLevel(2)==affx::TSV_OK) {
01285         spfFile.get(2,spfFile.m_v3_annotation_code_cidx,i_annotation_code);
01286         spfFile.get(2,spfFile.m_v3_context_code_cidx,i_context_code);
01287         spfFile.get(2,spfFile.m_v3_channel_code_cidx,i_channel_code);
01288         //
01289         pl.push_block(i_annotation_code,i_allele_code,i_context_code,i_channel_code,i_rep_type);
01290         //
01291         while (spfFile.nextLevel(3)==affx::TSV_OK) {
01292           spfFile.get(3,spfFile.m_v3_probe_id_cidx,i_probe_id);
01293           pl.push_probe(TO_ZEROBASED(i_probe_id));
01294         }
01295       }
01296     }
01297     //
01298     pl.set_numMatch(pl.probe_cnt()/pl.block_cnt());
01299     //pl.dump();
01300     plf.add_ProbeList(pl);
01301   } // while
01302 }
01303 
01304 void read_spf_v4(ProbeListFactory& plf,affx::SpfFile& spfFile)
01305 {
01306   ProbeListStl pl;
01307   //
01308   std::string i_name;
01309   int i_type;
01310   int i_num_match;
01311   int i_annotation_code;
01312   int i_allele_code;
01313   int i_context_code;
01314   int i_channel_code;
01315   int i_rep_type;
01316   int i_probe_id;
01317 
01318   //
01319   while (spfFile.nextLevel(0)==affx::TSV_OK) {
01320     pl.clear();
01321     //
01322     spfFile.get(0,spfFile.m_name_cidx,i_name);
01323     pl.set_name(i_name);
01324     //
01325     i_type=-1;
01326     spfFile.get(0,spfFile.m_type_cidx,i_type);
01327     pl.set_type(i_type);
01328     //
01329     i_num_match=-1;
01330     if (spfFile.m_num_match_cidx>=0) {
01331       spfFile.get(0,spfFile.m_num_match_cidx,i_num_match);
01332     }
01333     else {
01334       i_num_match=1;
01335     }
01336     pl.set_numMatch(i_num_match);
01337     //
01338     while (spfFile.nextLevel(1)==affx::TSV_OK) {
01339       spfFile.get(1,spfFile.m_v4_annotation_code_cidx,i_annotation_code);
01340       spfFile.get(1,spfFile.m_v4_allele_code_cidx,i_allele_code);
01341       spfFile.get(1,spfFile.m_v4_context_code_cidx,i_context_code);
01342       spfFile.get(1,spfFile.m_v4_channel_code_cidx,i_channel_code);
01343       spfFile.get(1,spfFile.m_v4_rep_type_cidx,i_rep_type);
01344       //
01345       pl.push_block(i_annotation_code,i_allele_code,i_context_code,i_channel_code,i_rep_type);
01346       //
01347       while (spfFile.nextLevel(2)==affx::TSV_OK) {
01348         spfFile.get(2,spfFile.m_v4_probe_id_cidx,i_probe_id);
01349         pl.push_probe(TO_ZEROBASED(i_probe_id));
01350       }
01351     }
01352     pl.set_numMatch(pl.probe_cnt()/pl.block_cnt());
01353     //pl.dump();
01354     plf.add_ProbeList(pl);
01355   } // while
01356 }
01357 
01358 void read_spf(ProbeListFactory& plf,affx::SpfFile& spfFile)
01359 {
01360   // try and help out if this is unset.
01361   if (spfFile.m_spf_format==0) {
01362     spfFile.determineFormat();
01363   }
01364   //
01365   if (spfFile.m_spf_format==2) {
01366     read_spf_v2(plf,spfFile);
01367   }
01368   else if (spfFile.m_spf_format==3) {
01369     read_spf_v3(plf,spfFile);
01370   }
01371   else if (spfFile.m_spf_format==4) {
01372     read_spf_v4(plf,spfFile);
01373   }
01374   else {
01375     APT_ERR_ABORT("Unable to determine SpfFile format.");
01376   }
01377 }
01378 
01379 void ProbeListFactory::readSpfFile(const std::string& spfName)
01380 {
01381   affx::SpfFile spfFile;
01382   spfFile.openSpf(spfName);
01383   // copy over some info.
01384   m_numCols=spfFile.m_header_numCols;
01385   m_numRows=spfFile.m_header_numRows;
01386   m_numChannels=spfFile.m_header_numChannels;
01387   m_chipTypes=spfFile.m_header_chipTypes;
01388   // m_header_num_probesets is there, but we dont care about it.
01389   //
01390   readSpfFile(spfFile);
01391   spfFile.close();
01392 }
01393 void ProbeListFactory::readSpfFile(affx::SpfFile& spfFile)
01394 {
01395   read_spf(*this,spfFile);
01396 }
01397 
01398 //////////
01399 
01400 void ProbeListFactory::writeToSpfFile_v2(affx::SpfFile& spfFile) const
01401 {
01402   ProbeListPacked pl;
01403   std::vector<int> v_block_sizes;
01404   std::vector<int> v_block_annotations;
01405   std::vector<int> v_block_alleles;
01406   std::vector<int> v_block_contexts;
01407   std::vector<int> v_block_channels;
01408   std::vector<int> v_block_rep_types;
01409   std::vector<int> v_probes;
01410 
01411   // name type num_blocks block_sizes block_annotations num_match num_probes probes
01412   // block_alleles block_contexts block_channels
01413 
01414   for (int pl_i=0;pl_i<m_probelist_vec.size();pl_i++) {
01415     pl=m_probelist_vec[pl_i];
01416     //
01417     v_block_sizes.clear();
01418     v_block_annotations.clear();
01419     v_block_alleles.clear();
01420     v_block_contexts.clear();
01421     v_block_channels.clear();
01422     v_block_rep_types.clear();
01423     v_probes.clear();
01424     //
01425     spfFile.set(0,spfFile.m_name_cidx,pl.get_name_string());
01426     spfFile.set(0,spfFile.m_type_cidx,pl.get_type());
01427     spfFile.set(0,spfFile.m_v2_num_blocks_cidx,pl.block_cnt());
01428     spfFile.set(0,spfFile.m_num_match_cidx,pl.get_numMatch());
01429 
01430     // construct the comma seperated block info.
01431     for (int i=0;i<pl.block_cnt();i++) {
01432       v_block_sizes.push_back(pl.get_blockSize(i));
01433       v_block_annotations.push_back(pl.get_blockAnn(i));
01434       //
01435       v_block_alleles.push_back(pl.get_blockAllele(i));
01436       v_block_contexts.push_back(pl.get_blockContext(i));
01437       v_block_channels.push_back(pl.get_blockChannel(i));
01438       v_block_rep_types.push_back(pl.get_blockRepType(i));
01439     }
01440     spfFile.set(0,spfFile.m_v2_block_sizes_cidx,v_block_sizes);
01441     spfFile.set(0,spfFile.m_v2_block_annotations_cidx,v_block_annotations);
01442     //
01443     if (spfFile.m_v2_block_alleles_cidx>=0) {
01444       spfFile.set(0,spfFile.m_v2_block_alleles_cidx,v_block_alleles);
01445     }
01446     if (spfFile.m_v2_block_contexts_cidx>=0) {
01447       spfFile.set(0,spfFile.m_v2_block_contexts_cidx,v_block_contexts);
01448     }
01449     if (spfFile.m_v2_block_channels_cidx>=0) {
01450       spfFile.set(0,spfFile.m_v2_block_channels_cidx,v_block_channels);
01451     }
01452     if (spfFile.m_v2_block_rep_types_cidx>=0) {
01453       spfFile.set(0,spfFile.m_v2_block_rep_types_cidx,v_block_rep_types);
01454     }
01455     //
01456     for (int i=0;i<pl.probe_cnt();i++) {
01457       v_probes.push_back(FROM_ZEROBASED(pl.get_probeId(i)));
01458     }
01459     spfFile.set(0,spfFile.m_v2_num_probes_cidx,(uint64_t)v_probes.size());
01460     spfFile.set(0,spfFile.m_v2_probes_cidx,v_probes);
01461     //
01462     spfFile.writeLevel(0);
01463   }
01464 }
01465 
01466 void ProbeListFactory::writeProbeListToSpfFile_v3(affx::SpfFile& spfFile, ProbeListPacked pl)
01467 {
01468   int probes_per_block;
01469   int p_i;
01470   int block_allele_code;
01471   int last_allele_code=-1;
01472 
01473   //
01474   spfFile.set(0,spfFile.m_name_cidx,pl.get_name_string());
01475   spfFile.set(0,spfFile.m_type_cidx,pl.get_type());
01476   spfFile.set(0,spfFile.m_num_match_cidx,pl.get_numMatch());
01477   spfFile.writeLevel(0);
01478   //
01479   probes_per_block=((pl.block_cnt()>0)?(pl.probe_cnt()/pl.block_cnt()):0);
01480   p_i=0;
01481   //
01482   for (int b_i = 0; b_i < pl.block_cnt(); b_i++) {
01483       block_allele_code = pl.get_blockAllele(b_i);
01484       if ( (b_i==0) || (last_allele_code != block_allele_code) ) {
01485           spfFile.set(1, spfFile.m_v3_allele_lbl_cidx, "allele");
01486           spfFile.set(1, spfFile.m_v3_allele_code_cidx, block_allele_code);
01487           spfFile.writeLevel(1);
01488           last_allele_code=block_allele_code;
01489       }
01490       //
01491       spfFile.set(2, spfFile.m_v3_context_lbl_cidx, "context");
01492       spfFile.set(2, spfFile.m_v3_annotation_code_cidx, pl.get_blockAnn(b_i));
01493       spfFile.set(2, spfFile.m_v3_context_code_cidx, pl.get_blockContext(b_i));
01494       if (spfFile.m_v3_channel_code_cidx>=0) {
01495           spfFile.set(2, spfFile.m_v3_channel_code_cidx, pl.get_blockContext(b_i));
01496       }
01497       spfFile.writeLevel(2);
01498       //
01499       for (int i=0;i<pl.get_blockSize(b_i);i++) {
01500           // FROM_ZEROBASED evals its arg twice.
01501           int probeid=pl.get_probeId(p_i++);
01502           spfFile.set(3, spfFile.m_v3_probe_id_cidx, FROM_ZEROBASED(probeid));
01503           spfFile.writeLevel(3);
01504       }
01505   }
01506 }
01507 
01508 void ProbeListFactory::writeToSpfFile_v3(affx::SpfFile& spfFile) const
01509 {
01510   ProbeListPacked pl;
01511 
01512   for (int pl_i=0;pl_i<m_probelist_vec.size();pl_i++) {
01513       pl=m_probelist_vec[pl_i];
01514       writeProbeListToSpfFile_v3(spfFile, pl);
01515   }
01516 
01517 }
01518 
01519 void ProbeListFactory::writeProbeListToSpfFile_v4(affx::SpfFile &spfFile, ProbeListPacked pl)
01520 {
01521   int probes_per_block;
01522   int p_i;
01523   spfFile.set(0,spfFile.m_name_cidx,pl.get_name_string());
01524   spfFile.set(0,spfFile.m_type_cidx,pl.get_type());
01525   spfFile.set(0,spfFile.m_num_match_cidx,pl.get_numMatch());
01526   spfFile.writeLevel(0);
01527   //
01528   probes_per_block=((pl.block_cnt()>0)?(pl.probe_cnt()/pl.block_cnt()):0);
01529   p_i=0;
01530   for (int b_i=0;b_i<pl.block_cnt();b_i++) {
01531     spfFile.set(1,spfFile.m_v4_block_lbl_cidx,"block");
01532     spfFile.set(1,spfFile.m_v4_annotation_code_cidx,pl.get_blockAnn(b_i));
01533     spfFile.set(1,spfFile.m_v4_allele_code_cidx,pl.get_blockAllele(b_i));
01534     spfFile.set(1,spfFile.m_v4_context_code_cidx,pl.get_blockContext(b_i));
01535     spfFile.set(1,spfFile.m_v4_channel_code_cidx,pl.get_blockChannel(b_i));
01536     spfFile.set(1,spfFile.m_v4_rep_type_cidx,pl.get_blockRepType(b_i));
01537     spfFile.writeLevel(1);
01538     //
01539     for (int i=0;i<probes_per_block;i++) {
01540       // FROM_ZEROBASED evals its arg twice.
01541       int probeid=pl.get_probeId(p_i++);
01542       spfFile.set(2,spfFile.m_v4_probe_id_cidx,FROM_ZEROBASED(probeid));
01543       spfFile.writeLevel(2);
01544     }
01545   }
01546 }
01547 
01548 void ProbeListFactory::writeToSpfFile_v4(affx::SpfFile& spfFile) const
01549 {
01550   ProbeListPacked pl;
01551 
01552 
01553   for (int pl_i=0;pl_i<m_probelist_vec.size();pl_i++) {
01554     pl=m_probelist_vec[pl_i];
01555     //
01556     writeProbeListToSpfFile_v4(spfFile, pl);
01557   }
01558 }
01559 
01560 
01561 void ProbeListFactory::writeToSpfFile(affx::SpfFile& spfFile) const
01562 {
01563   //
01564   if (spfFile.m_spf_format==2) {
01565     writeToSpfFile_v2(spfFile);
01566   }
01567   else if (spfFile.m_spf_format==3) {
01568     writeToSpfFile_v3(spfFile);
01569   }
01570   else if (spfFile.m_spf_format==4) {
01571     writeToSpfFile_v4(spfFile);
01572   }
01573   else {
01574     APT_ERR_ABORT("bad format");
01575   }
01576 }
01577 
01578 //////////
01579 
01580 void ProbeListFactory::writeSpfFile(const std::string& spfName,
01581                                     int spfFormat,
01582                                     int with_allelecontext,
01583                                     int with_channel) const
01584 {
01585   affx::SpfFile spfFile;
01586   // set some info which will be in the headers.
01587   spfFile.m_header_chipTypes=m_chipTypes;
01588   spfFile.m_header_numCols=m_numCols;
01589   spfFile.m_header_numRows=m_numRows;
01590   spfFile.m_header_numChannels=m_numChannels;
01591   spfFile.m_header_numProbesets=getProbeSetCount();
01592   // these will be used to define the format.
01593   spfFile.m_has_allele_info=with_allelecontext;
01594   spfFile.m_has_context_info=with_allelecontext;
01595   spfFile.m_has_channel_info=with_channel;
01596   // start writing.
01597   spfFile.writeSpf(spfName,spfFormat);
01598   //
01599   writeToSpfFile(spfFile);
01600   //
01601   spfFile.close();
01602 }
01603 
01604 void ProbeListFactory::writeSpfFile(const std::string& spfName,int spfFormat) const
01605 {
01606   writeSpfFile(spfName,spfFormat,1,1);
01607 }
01608 
01609 //////////
01610 
01611 /// This this the comparison function for sorting the names.
01612 /// It dereferences the 'plf' to get the names to pass to strcmp.
01613 class ProbeListFactory_NameIdxCmp {
01614 public:
01615   const ProbeListFactory* m_plf;
01616   ProbeListFactory_NameIdxCmp(const ProbeListFactory* plf) {
01617     m_plf=plf;
01618   }
01619   bool operator()(int a_idx,int b_idx) {
01620     const char* a_name=m_plf->getProbeListNameCstr(a_idx);
01621     const char* b_name=m_plf->getProbeListNameCstr(b_idx);
01622     int rv=strcmp(a_name,b_name);
01623     if (rv<0) {
01624       return true;
01625     }
01626     return false;
01627   };
01628 };
01629 
01630 void ProbeListFactory::sortName2Idx() const
01631 {
01632   // Because the index is built on demand, the message below
01633   // tends to show up in unexpected places -- like in the middle
01634   // of a progress meter on processing probesets
01635   // You can call "ensureSortedName2Idx()" yourself if you want to control
01636   // when this message is sent.
01637   Verbose::out(3,"Building and sorting probeset index.");
01638   m_name2idx_sortcnt++;
01639 
01640   // rebuild the index
01641   m_name2idx_vec.clear();
01642   m_name2idx_vec.reserve(m_probelist_vec.size());
01643   for (int i=0;i<m_probelist_vec.size();i++) {
01644     m_name2idx_vec.push_back(i);
01645   }
01646   //
01647   APT_ERR_ASSERT(m_name2idx_vec.size()==m_probelist_vec.size(),
01648                  "internal error. "
01649                  "(sort_cnt="+ToStr(m_name2idx_sortcnt)+
01650                  " m_probelist_vec="+ToStr(m_probelist_vec.size())+
01651                  " m_name2idx_vec="+ToStr(m_name2idx_vec.size()));
01652   //
01653   ProbeListFactory_NameIdxCmp comparer(this);
01654   sort(m_name2idx_vec.begin(),m_name2idx_vec.end(),comparer);
01655   m_name2idx_issorted=true;
01656 }
01657 
01658 void ProbeListFactory::assertName2IdxSorted(int verbose) const
01659 {
01660   APT_ERR_ASSERT(m_name2idx_vec.size()==m_probelist_vec.size(),"internal error!");
01661 
01662   int m_name2idx_vec_size=m_name2idx_vec.size();
01663 
01664   if (m_name2idx_vec_size>0) {
01665     const char* this_name=NULL;
01666     const char* last_name=m_probelist_vec[m_name2idx_vec[0]].get_name_cstr();
01667     //
01668     if (verbose==1) {
01669       printf("%d : '%s'\n",0,last_name);
01670     }
01671     for (int i=1;i<m_name2idx_vec_size;i++) {
01672       this_name=m_probelist_vec[m_name2idx_vec[i]].get_name_cstr();
01673       if (verbose==1) {
01674         printf("%d : '%s'\n",i,this_name);
01675       }
01676       APT_ERR_ASSERT(strcmp(last_name,this_name)<=0,"Unsorted vector.");
01677       last_name=this_name;
01678     }
01679   }
01680 }
01681 
01682 void ProbeListFactory::ensureSortedName2Idx() const
01683 {
01684   if (m_name2idx_issorted==false) {
01685     sortName2Idx();
01686     //
01687     assertName2IdxSorted(0); // debugging.
01688   }
01689   
01690   APT_ERR_ASSERT(m_name2idx_vec.size()==m_probelist_vec.size(),
01691                  "internal error. "
01692                  " sort_cnt="+ToStr(m_name2idx_sortcnt)+
01693                  " m_probelist_vec="+ToStr(m_probelist_vec.size())+
01694                  " m_name2idx_vec="+ToStr(m_name2idx_vec.size()));
01695 }
01696 
01697 /// This changes the order of the probes in m_probelist_vec to be
01698 /// in name order.
01699 void ProbeListFactory::sortFactoryByName()
01700 {
01701   ensureSortedName2Idx();
01702 
01703   int m_probelist_vec_size=m_probelist_vec.size();
01704 
01705   std::vector<ProbeListPacked> tmp_vec;
01706   tmp_vec.reserve(m_probelist_vec_size);
01707 
01708   for (int i=0;i<m_probelist_vec_size;i++) {
01709     int idx=m_name2idx_vec[i];
01710     APT_ERR_ASSERT(((idx>=0)&&(idx<m_probelist_vec_size)),"internal error!");
01711     tmp_vec.push_back(m_probelist_vec[idx]);
01712   }
01713   m_probelist_vec=tmp_vec;
01714 }
01715 
01716 /////
01717 
01718 /*
01719 class ProbeListFactory_NameFinder {
01720 public:
01721   const ProbeListFactory* m_plf;
01722   std::string m_name;
01723   const char* m_name_cstr;
01724 
01725   ProbeListFactory_NameFinder(const ProbeListFactory* plf,const std::string& name) {
01726     m_plf=plf;
01727     setSearchName(name);
01728   };
01729   void setSearchName(const std::string& name) {
01730     m_name=name;
01731     m_name_cstr=m_name.c_str();
01732   }
01733   // return true if a_idx is < then m_name_cstr
01734   bool operator()(int a_idx,int pretend_m_name_cstring_was_here) {
01735     const char* a_name=m_plf->getProbeListNameCstr(a_idx);
01736     int rv=strcmp(a_name,m_name_cstr);
01737     //printf("'%s'<=>'%s' => %d\n",a_name,m_name_cstr,rv);
01738     if (rv<0) {
01739       return true;
01740     }
01741     return false;
01742   };
01743 };
01744 */
01745 ////
01746 
01747 int ProbeListFactory::getProbeListIndexByName(const std::string& nameToFind) const
01748 {
01749   int name_idx;
01750   int probelist_idx;
01751   int idx_max;
01752   std::vector<int>::iterator i;
01753 
01754   ensureSortedName2Idx();
01755 
01756   APT_ERR_ASSERT(m_name2idx_vec.size()==m_probelist_vec.size(),"internal error.");
01757 
01758   // The MS library breaks this by reversing the comparison order
01759   // ProbeListFactory_NameFinder finder(this,nameToFind);
01760   // i=lower_bound(m_name2idx_vec.begin(),m_name2idx_vec.end(),0,finder);
01761   // name_idx=i-m_name2idx_vec.begin();
01762 
01763   // here is our own binary seach
01764   {
01765     const char* nameToFind_cstr=nameToFind.c_str();
01766     //
01767     int i_begin=0;
01768     int i=i_begin;
01769     int i_end=m_name2idx_vec.size();
01770 
01771     while (i_begin<i_end) {
01772       i=i_begin+(i_end-i_begin)/2;
01773       const char* i_name=getProbeListNameCstr(m_name2idx_vec[i]);
01774       int rv=strcmp(i_name,nameToFind_cstr);
01775       //
01776       //printf("%3d--%3d--%3d : '%s'<=>'%s' => %2d\n",i_begin,i,i_end,i_name,nameToFind_cstr,rv);
01777       //
01778       if (rv==0) { // equal, but maybe not the first.
01779         break;
01780       }
01781       if (rv<0) { // i_name<nameToFind
01782          i_begin=i+1;
01783       }
01784       else { // bigger
01785         i_end=i;
01786       }
01787     }
01788     // back up to the first one.
01789     while ((0<i)&&(strcmp(getProbeListNameCstr(m_name2idx_vec[i-1]),nameToFind_cstr)==0)) {
01790       i--;
01791     }
01792     name_idx=i;
01793     //printf("name_idx=%d\n",name_idx);
01794   }
01795 
01796   // turn the name_idx into a probelist_idx
01797   idx_max=m_probelist_vec.size();
01798   //Verbose::out(1,"name_idx = " + ToStr(name_idx));
01799   //Verbose::out(1,"idx_max = " + ToStr(idx_max));
01800   if ((name_idx>=0) && (name_idx<idx_max)) {
01801     probelist_idx=m_name2idx_vec[name_idx];
01802     //Verbose::out(1,"probelist_idx = " + ToStr(probelist_idx));
01803     //Verbose::out(1,"nameToFind = " + ToStr(nameToFind));
01804     //Verbose::out(1,"found nane = " + ToStr(getProbeListName(probelist_idx)));
01805     if (nameToFind==getProbeListName(probelist_idx)) {
01806       return probelist_idx;
01807     }
01808   }
01809   return -1;
01810 }
01811 
01812 ///
01813 ProbeListPacked ProbeListFactory::getProbeListByName(const std::string& name) const
01814 {
01815   return getProbeListAtIndex(getProbeListIndexByName(name));
01816 }
01817 // We dont want to do abort then it is not found as this function is used to
01818 // test for existence as well as getting the value.
01819 //    int idx = getProbeListIndexByName(name);
01820 //    if (idx < 0) {
01821 //        Err::errAbort("Couldn't find probeset with name: " + name);
01822 //    }
01823 //    return getProbeListAtIndex(idx);
01824 
01825 /////
01826 
01827 ProbeListPacked ProbeListFactory::getProbeListAtIndex(int i) const
01828 {
01829   if ((i>=0)&&(i<m_probelist_vec.size())) {
01830     return m_probelist_vec[i];
01831   }
01832   //
01833   //Verbose::out(1,"Did not find probelist at index " + ToStr(i));
01834   return ProbeListPacked(NULL);
01835 }

01843   return m_probelist_vec[i].get_name_string();

01846 {

01848   APT_ERR_ASSERT(i<m_probelist_vec.size(),"too big!");

01871 int
01872 ProbeListFactory::findProbeApidByName(const std::string& qName,int qPid,int qAllele,int qContext,int qChannel) const
01873 {
01874   int qPlIdx=getProbeListIndexByName(qName);
01875   if (qPlIdx<0) {
01876     return -1;
01877   }
01878   return findProbeApidByIdx(qPlIdx,qPid,qAllele,qContext,qChannel);
01879 }
01880 
01881 int
01882 ProbeListFactory::findProbeApidByIdx(int qPlIdx,int qPid,int qAllele,int qContext,int qChannel) const
01883 {
01884   if ((qPlIdx<0)||(qPlIdx>=m_probelist_vec.size())) {
01885     return -1;
01886   }
01887   return m_probelist_vec[qPlIdx].findProbeApid(qPid,qAllele,qContext,qChannel);
01888 }

01913 
01914 /// @brief     Build an index mapping ProbeId to Apid of _unique_ probeids
01915 ///            Having a non-unique mapping is ok, using it is not.
01916 void
01917 ProbeListFactory::buildProbeId2ApidIndex() const
01918 {
01919   // allocate our index
01920   if (m_probeid2apid_vecptr==NULL) {
01921     m_probeid2apid_vecptr=new std::vector<int>();
01922   }
01923 
01924   // Meanings for (probeid)=>apid.
01925   //   (In the order the values move through.)
01926   // -1  => no apid for this ProbeId
01927   //  0+ => the apid for this probe.
01928   //        It is unique, as we have only seen it once.
01929   // -2  => this probeid appears in multiple probesets.
01930   //        We have seen it more than once.
01931   //        the apids are unique, but the mapping of (probeid)=>apid is not.
01932   //        the mapping of (probeset,probeid)=>apid is.
01933 
01934   // start the index with all '-1's.
01935   int pid_max=m_numCols*m_numRows;
01936   m_probeid2apid_vecptr->resize(pid_max,-1); //
01937 
01938   // walk the packed probesets to build our index
01939   int psi_max=getProbeSetCount();
01940   for (int psidx=0;psidx<psi_max;psidx++) {
01941     ProbeListPacked psp=getProbeListAtIndex(psidx);
01942     // now walk the probes of this set.
01943     // the apids are assigned from the start of the block.
01944     int pidx_max=psp.probe_cnt();
01945     int apid=psp.getApidStart();
01946     for (int pidx=0;pidx<pidx_max;pidx++) {
01947       int probeid=psp.get_probeId(pidx);
01948       // ignore null probes.
01949       if (probeid==ProbeList::null_probe) {
01950         continue;
01951       }
01952       // we dont allow duplicates (Has the index been set already?)
01953       int oldval=(*m_probeid2apid_vecptr)[probeid];
01954       if (oldval==-1) { // unseen, enter the mapping.
01955         (*m_probeid2apid_vecptr)[probeid]=apid;
01956       }
01957       else if (oldval>=0) { // seen once already, this isnt unique. Flag and warn.
01958         Verbose::out(1,"buildProbeId2ApidIndex: probeId "+ToStr(probeid)+" has already been used in another probeset. (apid was:"+ToStr(oldval));
01959         (*m_probeid2apid_vecptr)[probeid]=-2;
01960       }
01961       else if (oldval==-2) { // already warned.
01962         // do nothing
01963       }
01964       else {
01965         APT_ERR_ABORT("internal error.");
01966       }
01967       // the apids are sequental, advance it.
01968       apid++;
01969     } // for probe
01970   } // for probeset
01971 }
01972 
01973 int
01974 ProbeListFactory::findProbeApidByProbeId(int qPid) const
01975 {
01976   // in bounds?
01977   int pid_max=m_numCols*m_numRows;
01978   if ((qPid<0)||(qPid>=pid_max)) {
01979     APT_ERR_ABORT("ProbeId "+ToStr(qPid)+" out of bounds. (0-"+ToStr(pid_max)+")");
01980   }
01981 
01982   // has the index been built?
01983   if (m_probeid2apid_vecptr==NULL) {
01984     buildProbeId2ApidIndex();
01985   }
01986 
01987   // simply look it up.
01988   int apid=(*m_probeid2apid_vecptr)[qPid];
01989   // "-1" is an ok return value. "-2" is not as that means it is ambiguous.
01990   // wrap in if statement otherwise we have performance overhead of all the ToStr()
01991   if(apid <= -2) {
01992     APT_ERR_ASSERT(apid!=-2,"ProbeId "+ToStr(qPid)+" is not unique. (apid="+ToStr(apid)+")");
01993     APT_ERR_ASSERT(apid>-2,"ProbeId "+ToStr(qPid)+" has unexpected apid value. (apid="+ToStr(apid)+")");
01994   }
01995   return apid;
01996 }
